poem:
"Scorch Song"

From Amazon to frost-bound shores, El Niño stirs, 
In 2024, the globe's furnace flares,
Whispered warnings written in the climate's curses.
Bengal, China and the Philippines bear
Unwanted gifts of heat, no each claim, no few reserves,
Even the Caribbean won't be spared.
As nature's breath turns searing, we discern,
Through world's woe, the echo of concern.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "El Niño forecast to drive record heat from the Amazon to Alaska in 2024 The current strong El Niño event is set to supercharge global heating and deliver record-breaking temperatures from the Amazon to Alaska in 2024, a new analysis has found. Coastal areas of India by the Bay of Bengal and by the South China Sea, as well as the Philippines and the Caribbean, are also likely to see unprecedented heat in the period". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
